entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 04 at 2:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: .Another round of widespread heavy rain will move through eastern Washington and northern Idaho late tonight through Sunday. Soils are fairly saturated and will see additional precipitation. Flash Flooding will be of high concern especially near recent burn scars which are particularly vulnerable to debris flows and mud slides. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING...

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 9:31AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Big Wood River at Hailey affecting Blaine County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 04 at 9:47AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Bitterroot River in Ravalli and Missoula counties is expected to rise to near minor flood stage... The Clark Fork above Missoula is forecast to rise to around minor flood

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left
